channel.desc: Whether its sports, esports, UCI, Ironman, F1, WRC, TV, music, festivals, films or videos, Red Bull TV has it all!

programme.title: A Deeper Shade of Blue
programme.desc: Surfing, at its inception, was about freedom, happiness and a connection to the ocean. From the birth of surfing to modern innovations, this is the story of the connection between humans and the sea.
programme.series-desc: This is not a surf movie. It's a film about freedom, innovation and connection with the natural world.

programme.title: Algo Está Pasando
programme.desc: Take a journey through 30 years of history and get a glimpse into the story behind the people who, despite limited resources, took rap into a country ruled by a political dictatorship.
programme.series-desc: Discover the story behind the people who took rap into a country ruled by a political dictatorship.

programme.title: Amazon High Tide
programme.desc: Big wave surfer Ramón Navarro is determined enough to cross the remote Amazon jungle in Brazil in search of a secret wave spot.
programme.series-desc: Ramón Navarro is a surfer brave enough to cross the Amazon jungle and find a secret wave spot.

programme.title: Riding Shotgun
programme.desc: In Toronto, Kriss Kyle meets up with Drew Bezanson, one of the world’s most progressive BMX park riders. Drew invites Kriss to ride in the renowned Joyride 150 park as well as the city’s hidden riding spots, which leads to a sensational new edit.
programme.series-desc: In Toronto, Kriss Kyle meets up with Drew Bezanson, one of the world’s most progressive BMX park riders.

programme.title: Riding Shotgun
programme.desc: Kriss Kyle goes to the X Games in Barcelona, then travels to Italy to ride street with BMXer Simone Barraco. Following a trick-filled session, Simone invites Kriss to his hometown of Genoa to ride local spots and sample his grandma’s famous ravioli.
programme.series-desc: Kriss Kyle goes to the X Games in Barcelona, then travels to Italy to ride street with BMXer Simone Barraco.

programme.title: Ross Edgley's Great British Swim
programme.desc: As we hit the half way point of the Great British Swim Ross reflects on how his body is adapting to suit the challenge, and gives us three reasons why he is in love with the Scottish coast.
programme.series-desc: As we hit the half way point Ross reflects on how his body is adapting to suit the challenge.

programme.title: Ross Edgley's Great British Swim
programme.desc: Coming up to the top of Great Britain Ross Edgley is facing Scotland's rough tides. Ross reflects on his swim speed so far and how much he's learned. Then when Ross gets in the water he encounters a massive basking shark.
programme.series-desc: Coming up to the top of Great Britain Ross Edgley faces Scotland's rough tides and a massive basking shark.

programme.title: Ross Edgley's Great British Swim
programme.desc: Ross Edgley takes on the brutal Moray Firth in northern Scotland when he gets a surprise in the skies above to celebrate his 100-day journey so far.
programme.series-desc: Ross Edgley takes on the brutal Moray Firth in northern Scotland and is cheered on from the skies above.

programme.title: In Search of Speed
programme.desc: Speed merchants Aksel Lund Svindal, Dominik Paris and Thomas Dressen take on one of the most iconic downhill tracks on the FIS World Cup ski tour: the Birds of Prey in Beaver Creek, Colorado, USA.
programme.series-desc: Skiers take on one of the most iconic downhill tracks, the Birds of Prey in Beaver Creek, Colorado, USA.

programme.title: In Search of Speed
programme.desc: Henrik Kristoffersen and Alexis Pinturault are gunning for seven-time overall world cup champion Marcel Hirscher’s crown. The three compete against each other at the Men's Giant Slalom race in Beaver Creek, Colorado.
programme.series-desc: Henrik Kristoffersen and Alexis Pinturault are gunning for seven-time overall champ Marcel Hirscher's crown.

programme.title: Road to Dakar 18
programme.desc: Take a look at how the Nosiglia brothers got started in racing and how it impacts their daily life. Their father, Bolivian racer Walter Nosiglia, played a huge part in their initial love of bikes, and it has continued to grow from there.
programme.series-desc: Find out how the Nosiglia brothers got started in motor racing and how it affects their daily life.

programme.title: Road to Dakar 18
programme.desc: Daniel and Walter Jr Nosiglia, sons of Bolivian racer Walter Nosiglia, discuss what motor racing has meant to their family, and how they plan to take on Dakar in 2018.
programme.series-desc: Daniel and Walter Jr Nosiglia talk about what motor racing means to their family.

programme.title: Road to Dakar 18
programme.desc: The Nosiglia brothers, sons of Dakar racer Walter Nosiglia, give a glimpse at how they train physically and mentally for Dakar 2018.
programme.series-desc: Take a look at the Nosiglia brothers train – physically and mentally – to prepare for Dakar 2018.

programme.title: Searching for Sound
programme.desc: Take a trip to the Indian mega-city of Mumbai, where we meet up with Sandunes, a music producer whose latest project has seen her take the chaotic and overwhelming sounds of the metropolis and meld them into a cohesive soundscape.
programme.series-desc: Sandunes is an Indian producer who's making the chaotic sounds of Mumbai into a cohesive form of music.

programme.title: Sail & Run
programme.desc: Christian Schiester's life was changed when he became an ultrarunner, and now life is changing again as he becomes a sailor. Schiester and his wife sail more than 4,000 nautical miles from the Seychelles to Bali.
programme.series-desc: Christian Schiester and his wife set out to sail more than 4,000 nautical miles from the Seychelles to Bali.

programme.title: Road to Rampage
programme.desc: Kyle Strait, Tom van Steenbergen and Andreu Lacondeguy make the pilgrimage to Red Bull Rampage to build their lines. With a new venue comes new variables and the riders must compete with the other 45 athletes to find the perfect line.
programme.series-desc: Shovels get put to dirt on a brand new course as the riders start planning and building their lines.

programme.title: Road to Rampage
programme.desc: The lines are built, the riders are ready, now it's time to ride. Kyle Strait and Andreu Lacondeguy are pre-qualified for the finals, but Tom van Steenbergen has to prove himself before advancing. They all want it, but only one can be the champion.
programme.series-desc: After all the preparation and training, it's time. The riders get their shot at Red Bull Rampage glory.

programme.title: Red Bull Street Style Tricktionary
programme.desc: Michał Rycaj talks about being one of Poland's first freestylers and the confluence of art and sport in his chosen craft before demonstrating his signature move: a double Around-the-World combined with a simultaneous 360-degree spin.
programme.series-desc: Poland native Michał Rycaj shares his signature double Around-the-World mixed with a simultaneous 360-spin.

programme.title: Red Bull Street Style Tricktionary
programme.desc: Youssef Ayman, better known as Yorok, talks about the self-expression integral to the freestyling life before sharing his Yorok Move, an innovative three-stage blend of a Magic Spin with a head duck into sitting cross-kneed catch.
programme.series-desc: Yorok demonstrates his self-titled three-stage hybrid of a Magic Spin, head duck, and cross-kneed catch.

programme.title: Red Bull Street Style Tricktionary
programme.desc: Tobias Becs reveals that his love of freestyle grew from its lack of rules and boundaries while requiring a focus on the technical aspects of ballhandling. His seemingly simple No Touch Combo requires just such a devotion to technical skills.
programme.series-desc: Tobias Becs reveals the devotion to technical skill required to pull off his seemingly simple No Touch Combo.

programme.title: Analog in Vienna
programme.desc: Utah rock band The Aces cut a live record straight to vinyl in one take, without editing. Join them as they're taken on a tour of Vienna before arriving at Supersense to prepare for the recording. Buy the finished result here: tinyurl.com/yb27gr5t.
programme.series-desc: Watch Utah rock band The Aces prepare to cut a live record straight to vinyl in one take, without editing.

programme.title: All In
programme.desc: The WSL Championship Tour has made it to Hawaii for the final two events of the 2018 season. It's a week to go until the women's championship, and Lakey Peterson and Carissa Moore both have their eyes on the prize.
programme.series-desc: The WSL Championship Tour has made it to Hawaii for the final two events of the 2018 season.

programme.title: Aaron Gwin's Off Season
programme.desc: American downhill mountain biker Aaron Gwin revisits his roots in California's Morongo Valley to talk about what it was like growing up in the area. He also takes the opportunity to ride some old trails on a mountain bike and a motocross bike.
programme.series-desc: Aaron Gwin goes back to his roots in California to talk about his days growing up and riding there.

programme.title: Aaron Gwin's Off Season
programme.desc: Aaron Gwin isn’t one to sit around – if there’s something fun to be done, he’s there. After a morning riding a local downhill trail, Aaron cuts loose with some friends at a climbing gym.
programme.series-desc: Aaron Gwin cuts loose with some friends, first on a local DH MTB trail, then at a climbing gym.

programme.title: Aaron Gwin's Off Season
programme.desc: Aaron Gwin hosts enduro champion Richie Rude at his home in Southern California and shows Richie his favourite local trails in the surrounding hills. The pair get a little competitive in the gym as Aaron shows Richie his off-season training regimen.
programme.series-desc: Aaron Gwin and enduro champ Richie Rude get a little competitive during a few days of off-season training.

programme.title: Perspective
programme.desc: Reflecting on how their different backgrounds influence their skating styles, four world class skaters join forces in Arizona to explore new territory and tricks.
programme.series-desc: Four skaters from different backgrounds and styles convene in Arizona to explore new territory and tricks.

programme.title: Hubertusjagd
programme.desc: In Madrid, Hubertus visits a very different type of factory: Factum Arte, where the dreams of the world's artists become reality. He also gets to know the street art collective Boa Mistura, hangs out with DJ and motorcycle racer Fonsi Nieto and more.
programme.series-desc: Hubertus von Hohenlohe presents the world's most exciting cities – this time, he says ¡Hola! from Madrid.

programme.title: In Search of Speed
programme.sub-title: Life on the Ski World Cup tour
programme.desc: Go behind the scenes at 21 iconic locations of the FIS World Cup tour with personal insights from the greatest skiers on the planet competing in Downhill, Super G, Giant Slalom, Slalom and Alpine. Hear how their passion drives them to go faster.
programme.series-desc: Take an inside look at the FIS World Cup tour from the eyes of the greatest skiers on the planet.

programme.title: In Search of Speed
programme.desc: Lindsey Vonn heads into the 2018 season just four wins shy of the most coveted record in skiing – 86 World Cup wins. Meanwhile, friend and competitor Sofia Goggia, fresh off a historic World Cup season, battles injury so she can return to the snow.
programme.series-desc: Lindsey Vonn heads into the 2018 season just four wins shy of the most coveted record in skiing.

programme.title: Lo Sound Desert
programme.sub-title: The Origins of Desert Rock Music
programme.desc: The low desert punk bands that came out of the Coachella Valley, California, in the 1980s, including Kyuss and Queens of the Stone Age, were products of a particular culture and geography, creating more than just a new style of music.
programme.series-desc: The culture and geography of 1980s Coachella Valley, California, gave rise to a rebellious new style of music.

programme.title: Moto 9
programme.sub-title: The world's best places for riding
programme.desc: Journey to the world's most incredible riding locations with riders who are worthy of such venues in Moto 9, the latest of the world's most progressive moto video franchise.
programme.series-desc: Journey to the world's most incredible riding locations with riders who are worthy of such venues.

programme.title: Into the Dirt
programme.desc: Bavarian mountain bike team InFocus shakes off the winter cobwebs with a unique trip in search of warmer riding spots. Their quest led them to the legendary Mount Etna in Sicily, one of the world's most active volcanoes.
programme.series-desc: MTB team InFocus takes a unique trip to the legendary Mount Etna, one of the world's most active volcanoes.

programme.title: Reel Rock
programme.desc: Ueli Steck is one of the world's fastest alpinists, but his latest quest could cement his place among legends. Ueli attempts to break the speed record on the north face of The Eiger, Switzerland with only crampons and axes in a sprint to the peak.
programme.series-desc: Ueli Steck is one of the world's fastest climbers. Setting The Eiger's speed record would make him a legend.

programme.title: Reel Rock
programme.desc: Climbing wide cracks is a brutal and especially American pursuit practised by a small band of burly climbers. Now two Brits, Tom Randall and Pete Whittaker – the Wide Boyz – travel to the United States to do battle with some offwidth climbs.
programme.series-desc: A pair of unlikely British climbers invade America to take on the toughest offwidth climbs in the country.

programme.title: Ride to the Roots
programme.desc: In the lead up to the 2016 Cliff Diving World Series, diver Jonathan Paredes returns to his hometown in Mexico to visit the people and places that helped shape his life and career. From the cliffs of Acapulco to the world stage, this is his story.
programme.series-desc: Leading up to the 2016 Cliff Diving World Series, diver Jonathan Paredes returns to where his career started.

programme.title: Fanáticos Pro
programme.desc: Mexican Sergio Ivan loves football and is a fan of Chivas. Ivan's other love is telling stories, which led him to becoming a chronicler of the Guadalajara team in Mexico.
programme.series-desc: Mexican Sergio Ivan's love of story-telling led to him becoming a chronicler for the Guadalajara team Chivas.

programme.title: Andes 6K+
programme.desc: After climbing seven mountains in a row, the team starts to feel the exhaustion and Max faces health issues mid-climb on Cerro El Toro.
programme.series-desc: The team starts to feel the exhaustion and Max faces health issues mid-climb on Cerro El Toro.

programme.title: Andes 6K+
programme.desc: After more than 55 days of expedition, Max and the team face Marmolejo in Chile. Sheer exhaustion starts to bring some of the team to a breaking point.
programme.series-desc: After more than 55 days of expedition, Max and the team face Marmolejo in Chile.

programme.title: Red Bull Skateboarding Presents: You Good?
programme.desc: Zion Wright , Jamie Foy and Alex Midler hit the road to find some of the best skate spots in the world. The three travel together to film and drop some of the heaviest skate action of their careers.
programme.series-desc: Zion Wright, Jamie Foy and Alex Midler hit the road to find some of the best skate spots in the world.

programme.title: Between the Lines
programme.desc: Marion Haerty’s boardercross and slopestyle technique got her a spot on the Freeride World Tour and led to her first podium finishes. But this wasn’t enough for her. Haerty’s driving force is progression: to become better, faster and stronger.
programme.series-desc: Marion Haerty’s driving force is progression: to become better, faster and stronger.

programme.title: Between the Lines
programme.desc: From hitting rails in the park to throwing a butter off a cliff on the mighty Bec des Rosses, Markus Eder has the ability to make everything look easy – but does it all come that easy, really?
programme.series-desc: Markus Eder has the ability to make everything look easy – but does it all come that easy, really?

programme.title: Ode to Muir: The High Sierra
programme.sub-title: A journey into a great American wilderness
programme.desc: Snowboarders Jeremy Jones and Elena Hight embark on an expedition into California's John Muir Wilderness. Their journey balances the challenges of winter with what it means to explore such a vast natural environment.
programme.series-desc: Snowboarders Jeremy Jones and Elena Hight embark on an expedition into California's John Muir Wilderness.

programme.title: Cultivation
programme.desc: Darryl 'Snake Eyez' Lewis talks about growing up in Compton, California, USA, winning the world's biggest tournament, and why he loves the Street Fighter IV character Zangief so much.
programme.series-desc: Darryl 'Snake Eyez' Lewis talks about growing up, winning tournaments, and his favourite game character.

programme.title: Cultivation
programme.desc: Snake Eyez makes his way to Japan, where he experiences the culture of a place completely foreign to him and starts his Street Fighter IV training.
programme.series-desc: Snake Eyez finally arrives in the land of Street Fighter: Japan.

programme.title: Fanáticos Pro
programme.desc: Lorena Amaro is such a devout fan, even her cat is black and white in honour of Atlético Mineiro, her favourite team.
programme.series-desc: Lorena Amaro is such a devout fan, even her cat is black and white in honour of her favourite team.

programme.title: Fanáticos Pro
programme.desc: Mexican Sergio Ivan loves football and is a fan of Chivas. Ivan's other love is telling stories, which led him to becoming a chronicler of the Guadalajara team in Mexico.
programme.series-desc: Mexican Sergio Ivan's love of story-telling led to him becoming a chronicler for the Guadalajara team Chivas.

programme.title: First Descent: Michoacan
programme.desc: The guys spend their first days in Michoacan scouting unexplored waterways and jungles and encountering dangerous situations before they even get in a boat. If it's this hard on land and in town, will Michaocan's rivers prove to be too much to take?
programme.series-desc: Kayaker buds Joel, Rafa, Dane, Kieran, Seth, and Juan embrace the unkown as they finally arrive in Michoacan.

programme.title: First Descent: Michoacan
programme.desc: The kayaking adventure of a lifetime continues. After an aerial scout, the guys realize they must rappel down a sheer canyon wall because the waterfall is just too dangerous to go over. But at the bottom of the rope they find their best run yet.
programme.series-desc: The Rio Cajones lives up to its name as the guys ride rapids and rappel rock walls in the canyon for two days.

programme.title: General Sipes
programme.sub-title: It all comes down to Straight Rhythm
programme.desc: Ryan Sipes has pushed himself all year travelling the world and racing in different events, but it all comes down to the final event at Red Bull Straight Rhythm.
programme.series-desc: Ryan Sipes travels the world all year, but it all comes down to the final event at Red Bull Straight Rhythm.

programme.title: Searching for Sound
programme.desc: Istanbul’s emerging talent Islandman and his musical partner-in-crime VeYasin hunt for hidden sound treasures. The journey will take them across thousands of miles searching for the sounds of their musical ancestors.
programme.series-desc: A pair of musicians travel thousands of miles searching for the sounds of their musical ancestors.

programme.title: AWOLNATION
programme.sub-title: How the band came to be
programme.desc: AWOLNATION may perform to sold-out shows, but their road to success has been filled with setbacks, frustrations and learning experiences. Frontman Aaron Bruno tells the band's story.
programme.series-desc: AWOLNATION's frontman Aaron Bruno, and the people who rode the wave with him, talk about the band's success.

programme.title: All In
programme.desc: As the 2018 season draws to an end, Jordy Smith, Carissa Moore, Julian Wilson and Lakey Peterson spend quality time with family, friends and coaches before the final two events of the year in Hawaii.
programme.series-desc: As the 2018 season draws to an end, the athletes spend time with family before the final events of the year.

programme.title: All In
programme.desc: The Banzai Pipeline on Hawaii's North Shore is home to the final and most prestigious event of the WSL Championship Tour. With the world title and triple crown also at stake, for Julian Wilson and Jordy Smith only a win at the Pipe will do.
programme.series-desc: Follow Julian Wilson and Jordy Smith as they look to win more than just the prestigious Pipe Masters trophy.

programme.title: Addicted to Life
programme.sub-title: Inside the mind of an action sports athlete
programme.desc: A globetrotting adventure immortalises the stories behind the achievements of modern action sports athletes. Among the all-star line-up are two of Maui's very own: big wave surfer Tyler Larronde and two-time Kiteboarding World Champion Jesse Richman.
programme.series-desc: The achievements of action sports athletes are celebrated in a collection of profiles.

programme.title: A History of...
programme.desc: Since the 18th century, the art of cliff diving has evolved well past its Hawaiian origins. Discover how the Cliff Diving World Series got its start and watch rare footage of cliff diving legends performing in their formative years.
programme.series-desc: In 18th century Hawaii, a king and his warriors dived off a cliff – it was the origins of modern cliff diving.

programme.title: I am the Engine
programme.desc: Discover the story of Waves for Change, the South African social enterprise using surf therapy to help break the wave of violence that shapes township life.
programme.series-desc: Meet the people behind Waves for Change, the African social enterprise using surf therapy to combat violence.

programme.title: I am the Engine
programme.desc: See how a simple mobile app hopes to dramatically cut down on traffic deaths in Rwanda, while offering riders a safer way to get to work and school.
programme.series-desc: See how a simple mobile app hopes to dramatically cut down on traffic deaths in Rwanda.

programme.title: Road to Dakar 18
programme.desc: The Nosiglia brothers, sons of Dakar racer Walter Nosiglia, give a glimpse at how they train physically and mentally for Dakar 2018.
programme.series-desc: Take a look at the Nosiglia brothers train – physically and mentally – to prepare for Dakar 2018.

programme.title: Searching for Sound
programme.desc: Take a trip to the Indian mega-city of Mumbai, where we meet up with Sandunes, a music producer whose latest project has seen her take the chaotic and overwhelming sounds of the metropolis and meld them into a cohesive soundscape.
programme.series-desc: Sandunes is an Indian producer who's making the chaotic sounds of Mumbai into a cohesive form of music.
